root: ^Your mission for Kellis is over. Every asset you collected rests in your cargo bay, awaiting review at Dispatch. But, even if its over on paper, there is still the matter of the solar system. Your ship hovers near the red star as it grows.

^Portunus speaks, its voice louder than ever before, "This should be over. If not for you, child, if not for your loyalty/blindness. We gathered these cursed objects/chains that they may be annihilated by the heat of the dying star, but always you were sent to steal them back. Even if billions die, billions more will fall to Kellis' rule. Cast off their stolen power, let it rot/burn, do not let them win."

Agree: ^You take the fruits of your labor, the prototypes and ancient tech Kellis so desparately wanted you to get out of this dying system, and you drop them out the airlock. They float gently towards the red sun and disintegrate. And with it, any chance at passing Kellis' final test.
^"Despite the lords who command you, you are a noble spawn. We misjudged you. Seek the stars for our return." The voice then vanishes. You can only hope that it was worth it.
Refuse: ^You tell Portunus that you cannot abandon the work you've done for Kellis here.

^It replies, "Remember this moment. Remember that you gave them power over the world/over you. And remember: You have made an enemy of us." The voice then vanishes. You can only hope that it was worth it.
Scene_2: ^With Portunus' voice finally gone from your mind, you have Lanri check her readings on the sun. They have not returned to normal, the sun will reach the point of no return in hours.
Stop_Super: ^But you already burned a hole in your pocket to fix this. With Lanri's readings, you are able to coordinate efforts to clean up the Midas scrap orbiting the sun. It doesn't have an immediately evident effect, but the sun stops expanding, and soon afterwards, you pass the point when it was supposed to explode. Once you have confirmation that it's stable, Lanri smiles, "We did it, boss." She solemnly fist bumps a nearby wall. "Thanks for giving me the chance. To do something good."
^Both of you turn your attention towards the planets of Avanshore, where Midas creatures roam. Lanri shrugs, "Well uhm- can't will them all, I suppose."
Supernova: ^The sun continues to expand unimpeded, the red glow cast across Avanshore's planets. Lanri shuts herself in her quarters, and doesn't speak to you. You didn't use her solution, and this is the price.
^The only matter left is the Midas corruption. Though with the impending supernova, you don't know if there's any sense trying to fix it anymore.
Scene_3_Stopped: ^A transmission reaches you, displaying your boss, "Alright. The mission is over. Head back to base."
^The CEO doesn't seem to notice or care about the corrupted people you're leaving behind, but you know he has the funds to do something about it.
^"What are you waiting for," he says. "We're done here."
Scene_3_Supernova: ^A transmission reaches you, displaying your boss, "Alright. The mission is over. Head back to base."
^The CEO doesn't seem to notice or care about the corrupted people you're leaving behind, but you know he has the funds to do something about it.
^"What are you waiting for," he says. "We're done here."
AcceptHelp_Stopped: ^You ask him if he could bring in a team to cure the Midas corruption.
^He sighs, "What does that do for us?"
^You tell him that if they step in as saviors, their PR will recieve a huge bump. It's the only argument you can use with him.
^He hums to himself for a couple seconds, and shrugs, "Alright. No one knows we caused it at this point, might as well take the credit. Head back to base, I'll handle this."

^Kellis' representatives arrive in droves from Dispatch. They begin to set up bases across Avanshore's myriad planets, to rapidly try to understand what the corruption is and how to fix it. Under Kellis' supervision, a cure is found within days, and while it leaves scarring across the cured, it leaves them alive.

^It seems like your entire ship lets out a sigh of relief. It wasn't your job, but you saved Avanshore twice over, not only preventing the death of their star, but ensuring that Kellis' fixes its own mistakes. With your company's help, you were able to do something good.
DeclineHelp_Stopped: ^You tell him that you are returning immediately and he nods, "Get out before that sun goes out." The transmission cuts out as you leave. Behind you, the sun continues to grow.

^You may have saved Avanshore, but not its people. Without a cure, the Midas beasts roam rampant, claiming dominion over many of Avanshore's worlds. The survivors will be evacuated over months, but at least there are survivors.
^You are summoned to Dispatch to review the assets.
AcceptHelp_Supernova: ^You ask him if he could bring in a team to cure the Midas corruption.
^He sighs, "What does that do for us?"
^You tell him that if they step in as saviors, their PR will recieve a huge bump. It's the only argument you can use with him.
^He hums to himself for a couple seconds, and shrugs, "Alright. No one knows we caused it at this point, might as well take the credit. Head back to base, I'll handle this."

^Kellis' representatives arrive in droves and begin to capture Midas beasts, pulling them out of the system and studying the corruption. Under their supervision, a cure is found within days, but it is only used on a select few.

^Before the cure can be rolled out, the sol expands, incinerating nearby planets, and pulling the further ones in. The death toll climbs, emergency signals sound, and suddenly the star winks out. You shutter every window as a terrible blue light floods the void. Once you can get a visual of the solar system, there's no solar system left.
^Dispatch rests comfortably outside of the explosion's reach and soon calls you back to review the assets.
DeclineHelp_Supernova: ^You tell him that you are returning immediately and he nods, "Get out before that sun goes out." The transmission cuts out as you leave. Behind you, the sun continues to grow.

^While it was never your job, you failed in every respect to protect Avanshore. Its planets are in ruins, infested with corrupted beings, which are soon incinerated by its expanding sol. The death toll climbs, emergency signals sound, and suddenly the star winks out. You shutter every window as a terrible blue light floods the void. Once you can get a visual of the solar system, there's no solar system left.
^Dispatch rests comfortably outside of the explosion's reach and soon calls you back to review the assets.
